name: Baked Cod with Roasted Red Pepper Horseradish Sauce
author: Scott in  MA
summary: This baked fish is easy to make and busting with flavor. Fillets are seasoned with garlic pepper, then bathed in a spicy red pepper and horseradish sauce, topped with a Cajun breading, and baked until golden brown.
ingredients: 1 (6 ounce) jar roasted red peppers - drained, patted dry, and diced
4 large cod fillets, rinsed and dried with paper towels
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Into a food processor, place the roasted red peppers*, horseradish sauce, and Worcestershire sauce
Pour 1/4 cup roasted red pepper sauce into a 13x9-inch baking dish, and spread to coat the bottom
Place fish in baking dish, and season with garlic pepper
Sprinkle each fillet with crushed Cajun snack mix
Bake in preheated oven until the crumbs start to brown, about 20 to 25 minutes
